 As a Web Developer, you will be a part of our Engineering team of 40 people. We have engineering team members throughout the Nordics, but your closest colleagues will be in Östersund, Lappeenranta, Helsinki or Oulu. This team is spread in those four locations, so you can choose whichever location is more convenient for you.

 Your working routine will include the development of our core product as well as special projects. The core product tasks consist of developing new features, documenting and discussing your work, reviewing code, and helping fellow colleagues in solving problems. You will also get to demo the features you have built to others. Special projects for our customers can be for example additional features or special integrations. The team works with the Scrum method in two-week sprints.
 Besides your developer teammates, you will work closely with the product owners, a UX Designer, and testers. We hope that you are also able to pitch into the discussions on how some features should be implemented or how quality assurance issues can be solved.
 After the first 6 months, we expect you to have a good understanding of our product, our processes and know the key stakeholders you are working with. After that, you will be able to work independently and many of the features you have been developing are already in production.
 Job duties briefly: ️
 Full-stack development. The main focus is on the back-end.
 Developing high-quality code and working with testing related issues
 Figuring out best practices for how things should be solved
 Creating solutions for the needs presented by the Product team and/or our clients, Customer Success, Support, or Sales teams.
 To succeed in this role, we see that you need to have:
 2+ years of working experience with development tasks. Experience in building a Saas product that is used by lots of people is a great plus.
 Ability to work with both back- and front-end tasks, with an emphasis on the back-end. You will also need to have an understanding of databases and be able to consider both security and performance issues.
 Solid work experience with PHP and SQL. We use mainly MySQL and PHP7.
 Familiarity with some front-end technology. For new development, we use mainly React, Redux, Javascript, and Typescript.
 Good communication skills in English. You will need to be able to document, present, and discuss your work with your teammates and other stakeholders. No Finnish skills needed!
 Why join LeadDesk?
 We will support your development! At LeadDesk we know that keeping up to date with what is happening in the field is crucial for company success. So we also want to support our employees to constantly develop themselves. You can do this via participating in different events and/or conferences as well as online training and learning from each other inside the team.
 Endless opportunity to learn and develop as a versatile professional through your work as well. We are quite a small team, so you will get the chance to take part in a variety of development tasks using different technology. We can say with confidence that you will broaden your technical skills!
 The opportunity to influence your own role and responsibilities. It is possible to take more responsibility and ownership for certain features or areas of the development process.
 With us, you can experience the best of both worlds – the stability of an already stable, publicly listed company but also the possibility to influence things and take responsibility for your work often associated with start-ups.
 Inspiring company events like annual Kick-Off event abroad & other happenings throughout the year.
 Last but not least - THE PEOPLE of LeadDesk. You will be a part of the international (over 10+ nationalities) talented, and the ambitious group that supports and helps each other!
 Basic information about the position:
 Start day: According to agreement
 Working hours: Full time
 Employment period: Permanent
 Salary: According to agreement
 Place of work: Östersund, Helsinki, Lappeenranta OR Oulu
 How to apply: 
We are continuously screening and contacting candidates and will fill the position as soon as we find the right person. Could it be you? Great! – We can’t wait to meet you! Let us know about yourself rather today than tomorrow.
 Apply with your CV or with your LinkedIn profile as soon as possible.
 If you have any questions about the position, don’t hesitate to contact Laura from our Talent Acquisition team.
 Laura Honkanen: phone +358 40 921 0809, email laura.honkanen(at)leaddesk.com

LeadDesk is the Software behind Sales and Customer Service Superstars. We believe that happy agents are the key to better business.
 We are a listed growth company. Currently, we are the market leader in the Nordics - aiming next to be the market leader in Europe. We are well on the way and already have over 20 000 happy agents in 34 different countries making millions of contacts every day.
